website_summaries.verdict: A smaller hammer that's comfortable in the hand and suitable for tight areas.
pros: Handle is made of contoured rubber for comfort
Smaller size is perfect for certain work conditions, including tight spaces
cons: Hammer may be too small for some work applications
It's great for the tool box, but due to its smaller size, it shouldn't be the only hammer you own

customer_reviews.title: Great little hammer.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daughter when doing Lowe's Build and Grow projects. They only provide claw hammers which scares me a little when I see the claw going towards her face while hammering. She can use her two small hands on it and it has enough weight to be very effective. I have even used it on a couple projects around the house. I would recommend it for kids, projects in tight spaces, or even just general use.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Hammer!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a smallish hammer to add to a small toolbag. Didn't want or need a regular size one. Just big enough to handle minimal jobs around the RV. This was perfect for what I needed. I like the fact that it's short, so one can get into restricted spaces. And the plastic handle is excellent! It should last forever. I'm just delighted with this.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. McGleish

customer_reviews.title: Stubby hammer 🔨
customer_reviews.text: This size hammer is perfect for my jewery stamping ✅
customer_reviews.author: michele  knight

customer_reviews.title: Stubby Ball Pein Hammer is great in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Pittsburgh Stubby Ball Pein (8 oz) Hammer to use in my kitchen. Upon receiving it, I sterilized it with an alcohol wash. I love the size and use it to tap the flat edge of my long knives when I cut melons or corn on the cob. I found this extra help is beneficial for my weakening wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Niagara,NY

customer_reviews.title: These are Awesome
customer_reviews.text: You would be surprised how nice these are. Even for a small hammer they can do quite allot and they are the perfect size for your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great For Truss
customer_reviews.text: Using this for putting together aluminum truss (Chauvet TRUSST Glo Totems). Small and compact for storage and transport. Works great for hammering in pins for the top and bottom plates – DJ AFINO
customer_reviews.author: DJ AFINO

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Mini Hammer
customer_reviews.text: Used it to drive tiny nails. Perfect for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Arboleda Crisostomo

customer_reviews.title: Apparently made in Pittsburgh, China
customer_reviews.text: Imagine my disappointment when this hammer came and was made in China. The hammer is fine, turns out you can smash stuff with it pretty easy. I was just hoping for Made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: Will Caudill

customer_reviews.title: Satisfies TSA length requirements
customer_reviews.text: I needed a hammer that was short of enough for TSA to allow me to carry it on my luggage, and this satisfied. At the end of the day, it is a short hammer, and it does its job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: I. G.

customer_reviews.title: ... than what it was made for but it works great and I love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a different purpose than what it was made for but it works great and I love it!! Awesome product!!!
customer_reviews.author: corey350

customer_reviews.title: Ice Breaker
customer_reviews.text: Liked material quality, size, weight and for purpose of breaking bag ice in my Freezer.
customer_reviews.author: robert obrian

customer_reviews.title: lightweight but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: given as a gift. super lightweight and was what I expected when purchased
customer_reviews.author: lauren adams

customer_reviews.title: This stubby is perfect for my job
customer_reviews.text: In my work I use a small tool bag with limited tools. This stubby is perfect for my job. Can't do without one. I don't hammer nail, but need to tap some thing that don't require a lot of force. This is the best 'stubby hammer' I've every owned.
customer_reviews.author: Murray

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little hammer
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size and weight for those little "tapping" jobs....paint can lids, picture frame hooks, anything that needs a little gentle persuasion. Also handy for nailing in close quarters .
customer_reviews.author: ERM319

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: Grear weight and fits in my small line bag.and its well made
customer_reviews.author: Bronx geek

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tool
customer_reviews.text: A great little hammer for when you don't need a full sized ball peen or space is limited and you need a short handle. I like the size. Appears to be good quality - I mean it's a hammer and should work well for beating on stuff, right?
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: bought to go with new stamp set works great and takes up little space
customer_reviews.author: happy camper

customer_reviews.title: great little stubby hammer
customer_reviews.text: great little stubby hammer, gotta get in some tight spaces at work and it gets it done. nearly half my work crew owns one of these, its great.
customer_reviews.author: andrew irish

customer_reviews.title: Small and portable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use in small places which is why I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Ogle

customer_reviews.title: Handy and portable for light duty hammering
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to chip away heavy calcium deposits from my pool walls. Good size, weight and is waterproof. No rust yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition for my workshop
customer_reviews.text: A nice addition for my workshop . . . purchased to have, just in case. Made very well and surprisingly heavy for the size. I have no complaints. Recommended purchase for those times when you might wish you had something like this.
customer_reviews.author: siberianmo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tiny hammer
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tiny hammer! I use it under counters and in tight spaces. Helps to reduce chance of damaging close unremovable pipes and fixtures.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Baker

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product at a good price and fits in the tightest of spaces.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size in a product of high quality that is well made, fits in any toolbox and gets the job done in tight spots.
customer_reviews.author: EricTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Super Handy and good quality. Carry it in my Motorcycle tool kit.
customer_reviews.author: Glock36

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small hammer
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my 5 year old, but I can also use it too since it's a real hammer. Great size for kids or adults.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Very useful, very handy
customer_reviews.text: I must have 8-9 hammers and this one is the go-to one for many jobs. Very useful, very handy.
customer_reviews.author: George Thompson

customer_reviews.title: I am amazed at how nice and solid this little hammer is
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed at how nice and solid this little hammer is. I bought it to hammer rivets with, but my wife saw it and took it to do little projects and hang pictures with. Great small hammer!
customer_reviews.author: Novaman

customer_reviews.title: Just a plain ol hammer. keep it in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Just a plain ol hammer. keep it in my work pouch because of its size and weight. Beats beating your adjustable wrenches up
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Weighted and compact
customer_reviews.text: This short weighted hammer is perfect for hammering my metal jewelery projects.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: have several friends that also bought this item. is very usefull
customer_reviews.author: Roy Johnston

customer_reviews.title: fortunately they all made it
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was insufficient for a heavy hammer, fortunately they all made it!
customer_reviews.author: dgriff80

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have one, get one. Very useful tool - you'd be amazed at how often you'll find yourself eschewing a regular hammer to use this instead.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: 8 OZ Stubby Ball Pein Hammer
customer_reviews.text: Perfect hammer for a kitchen drawer, very easy to maneuver in tight places. I would recommend it to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great space saver if you just need a small hammer in a pouch.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: It's not special.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice cheap hammer. It's decently comfortable and durable. I certainly couldn't break it myself. It's the same size as other stubby hammers too.
customer_reviews.author: Chaplin Tarshis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job intended
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, durable, good price and totally hits the nail on the head.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Helper

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer
customer_reviews.text: Great hammer, light little thing that I bought to experiment with some hammering on a cymbal for my drum set. It came a day late but the hammer makes up for it
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all of those close tolerance places
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for all of those close tolerance places. Been using it daily. I'm an aircraft sheet metal mechanic. Love it. Don't know how I went so long without.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Essential for Metal Work
customer_reviews.text: Great weight and compact. Easy to use in small places.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Hammer
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size hammer for me to put in my saddle pack
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Right size tool for tight spot.
customer_reviews.text: Right size for tight spot. But price is not good enough.
customer_reviews.author: tut

customer_reviews.title: Really small hammer. Almost too small. But for ...
customer_reviews.text: Really small hammer. Almost too small. But for REALLY tight areas that call for a light touch it is just the ticket.
customer_reviews.author: chris mason

product_meta.title: Pittsburgh Stubby Ball Pein Hammer, 8 oz
product_meta.description: Stubby ball pein hammer, heat treated drop forged steel head, high impact fiberglass soft cusion grip handle, 8 oz head with short curved handle for easy grip, ideal for working in tight places.
feature_bullets: 8 Oz. Heat Treated Drop Forged Steel Head
6-1/2 In. Long - Ideal for Use in Confined Areas
Nonslip Rubber Contoured Soft Cushion Grip Handle for Added Comfort

specifications.Material: Heat-Treated Steel, Fiberglass Handle, and Rubber Grip
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars123 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
